results.definition: that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law
examples: he feels that you are in the wrong
something is wrong with the engine

results.definition: any harm or injury resulting from a violation of a legal right
not correct; not in conformity with fact or truth
examples: the report in the paper is wrong
the clock showed the wrong time
found themselves on the wrong road
it was the wrong moment for a joke

results.definition: not appropriate for a purpose or occasion
characterized by errors; not agreeing with a model or not following established rules
examples: the wrong side of the road

results.definition: not in accord with established usage or procedure
examples: the wrong way to shuck clams

results.definition: based on or acting or judging in error
examples: it is wrong to think that way

results.definition: contrary to conscience or morality or law
examples: it is wrong for the rich to take advantage of the poor

results.definition: used of the side of cloth or clothing intended to face inward
